wikipedia_page.main: Avril Margaret Dankworth (April 1922 – March 2013) was an English music educator who established the week-long summer Avril Dankworth Children's Music Camps (now the National Music Camps) for children aged between 7 and 17 in Wavendon, near Milton Keynes, in mid-1970. She also sung, taught music, authored multiple books and helped introduce the idiom in school music curriculum.

response: Alumni from the National Youth Music Camps, founded by Avril Dankworth, include Guy Chambers, Dominic Miller, Quentin Collins and Thom Yorke
*Avril Dankworth (1922–2013), English music educator, sister of John Dankworth and sister-in-law of Cleo Laine
